medical_history.chief_complaint: A 6.5-month-old boy was admitted due to fever, rash, and thrombocytopenia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until the day before admission when increased bruising was noted on the thighs, attributed to use of a jumping chair. On the morning of admission, there was additional bruising and 'broken capillaries' on the cheeks and eyelids.
medical_history.past_medical_history: At 3 months of age, intermittent urticaria developed with small amounts of a milk-based formula. No history of trauma, epistaxis, gingival bleeding, or blood in urine/stool. Born by cesarean section due to preeclampsia, with current immunizations excluding influenza A and seasonal influenza vaccines.
medical_history.family_history: A cousin of the mother had splenomegaly of unknown cause. No known family history of hematologic disorders.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with parents and two dogs, does not attend day care, and has no exposures to sick persons.
